sentence: Salesforce.com CRM just released its first quarter fiscal 2017 earnings results, posting earnings of $0.08 per share and revenue of $1.92 billion.
Currently, CRM has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), but it is subject to change following the release of the company's latest earnings report.
Here are 5 key statistics from this just announced report below.
Matched earnings estimates.
The company posted earnings of $0.08 per share, in-line with the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $0.08 per share.
This number excludes $0.02 from non-recurring items.
Beat revenue estimates.
The company saw revenue figures of $1.92 billion, surpassing our consensus estimate of $1.892 billion and increasing 27% year-over-year.
Cash generated from operations was $1.05 billion, an increase of 43% year-over-year.
Total cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities finished the quarter at $3.72 billion.
Raised fiscal 2017 revenue guidance to $8.16 billion-8.20 billion, and for Q2, revenue is projected to be approximately $2.005 billion-2.015 billion, an increase of 23% year-over-year.
CRM was up $4.62, or 5.93%, to $82.49 as of 4:36 PM ET in after-hours trading shortly after its earnings report was released.

Here's a graph that looks at Salesforce's performance vs. its peers over the past three months:

Salesforce.com Inc. (CRM) vs. Peers Percent Change Over Time - 3 Months | FindTheCompany

Salesforce.com is the market and technology leader in on-demand business services.
The company's Salesforce suite of on-demand CRM applications allows customers to manage and share all of their sales, support, marketing and partner information on-demand.

The Salesforce Platform, the world's first on- demand platform, enables customers, developers and partners to build powerful new on-demand applications that extend beyond CRM to deliver the benefits of multi-tenancy and The Business Web across the enterprise.
Check back later for our full analysis on Salesforce's first quarter earnings report!
